intro: Acinodendron rubricans, commonly known as the red-fruited acinodendron, is a tropical shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruits are distinctive, being bright red and fleshy, which attract various bird species. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats within lowland forests.
